mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter: Jane C. Washington to John Augustine Washington III, Mount Vernon, 1842 March 11
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Jane Charlotte Blackburn, 1786-1855
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Jane writes in response to Augustine's letter dated March 7, 1842 that Gabriel Johnson, the enslaved man who ran away from Mount Vernon, has arrived at Jane's plantation. Jane writes, "Please come up without delay." Autograph letter signed, 1 page, with integral address panel.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Slaves
Mount Vernon (Va. : Estate)
Johnson, Gabriel, 1820-
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: John Augustine Washington III and Descendants Papers
